headline: Novo Nordisk launches GLP-1 pill, bank stocks rally
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Novo Nordisk (NVO) shares rising after the pharmaceutical prepares to launch its oral GLP-1 weight-loss pill while major bank stocks rally to new intraday record highs. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Financial Stocks Poised for Record as JPMorgan Nears Milestone Closing Price
summary: The S&P 500’s financials sector was on track for a record closing high on Monday as investors appeared to find more opportunities than risk in the wake of the Trump administration’s intervention in Venezuela.  JPMorgan Chase, the largest U.S. lender by assets and the second-largest component of the financials sector index after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, jumped 3.3%.  Jamie Dimon’s JPMorgan was on pace to close above a market cap of $900 billion for the first time on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

raw.headline: Financial Stocks Poised for Record as JPMorgan Nears Milestone Closing Price

Jamie Dimon’s JPMorgan was on pace to close above a market cap of $900 billion for the first time on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Duolingo Had a Disastrous 2025. Why BofA Thinks the Stock Can Surge in 2026.
summary: With much of Wall Street having soured on  Duolingo  analysts at  BofA  Securities are urging investors to buy low.  BofA upgraded Duolingo stock to Buy from Neutral in a research note Monday, though it lowered its target for the stock price to $250 from $301.  It has been weighed down by fears about how artificial-intelligence translation could affect interest in learning languages, as well as weak near-term financial guidance.

headline: How Recent Analyst Resets Are Rewriting The Story For Bath & Body Works (BBWI)
summary: The latest model update for Bath & Body Works keeps the fair value estimate steady at 24.35, while making only modest tweaks to the assumptions that feed into that figure. A slightly lower discount rate and largely unchanged revenue growth inputs line up with the mixed research tone, where analysts see solid brand equity and new leadership offset by softer demand, heavier promotions and limited visibility on when trends might stabilize. headline: Investors may go value hunting in 2026 as AI rally matures
summary: Global investors will actively seek opportunities this year in undervalued pockets of financial markets as growing concerns over an AI bubble push traders to look beyond highly valued technology stocks, according to several analysts.  U.S. stocks were volatile in 2025, plunging to near bear market territory in April following President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs before eventually ​rebounding to record highs.  The upward momentum is expected to continue in 2026, analysts said, though investors may have to get selective about the assets they pick.

headline: Investors Expect the Market to Keep Rallying This Year
summary: 3.7% That's how much Bank of America expects the S&P 500 to increase in 2026. JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs expect the index to rise more. Should the S&P 500 climb for a fourth consecutive year, it would be the longest such streak since 2007.

headline: What Lennar (LEN)'s Sole Underperform Rating From Bank of America Means For Shareholders
summary: In recent days, Bank of America named Lennar its sole “Underperform”-rated stock among its top short ideas for the first quarter, citing potential headwinds tied to housing demand, interest rates, and supply constraints. This bearish stance shines a spotlight on how exposed Lennar’s business model may be to a more challenging operating backdrop in US homebuilding. Next, we’ll examine how Bank of America’s underperform rating and short call could reshape Lennar’s existing investment narrative...
